context: via Make.com workflows (deprecated - use n8n instead)
description: DEPRECATED: Automated lead enrichment using Make.com workflows (60-80% enrichment, 15-20 minutes setup). Deprecated in favor of n8n for better flexibility and cost.
deprecated_reason: n8n provides better flexibility, lower cost, and more control
alternatives: TASK-TEMPLATE-014 (AI HTML Parsing via n8n) - Advanced
skills_required: SKL-062 (built enrichment pipelines via n8n - updated tool)

deprecation_notice.reason: n8n offers better flexibility, lower cost, more control
deprecation_notice.impact: Make.com still works but not recommended for new workflows
deprecation_notice.historical_value: Documented for teams currently using Make.com

why_deprecated: n8n offers more flexibility and control
Make.com pricing higher for automation use cases
n8n has better community and integrations
n8n more suitable for technical users
Industry trend toward n8n for lead gen workflows

for_flexibility.why_better: More control, custom logic, lower cost

make_com_vs_n8n.pricing: Make.com: Higher per operation | n8n: Lower, self-hosted option
make_com_vs_n8n.flexibility: Make.com: GUI-focused | n8n: More code flexibility
make_com_vs_n8n.community: Make.com: Smaller | n8n: Larger, more active
make_com_vs_n8n.use_case_fit: Make.com: General automation | n8n: Better for lead gen/scraping
make_com_vs_n8n.recommendation: Use n8n for new lead gen workflows

migration_guide.step_2: Set up n8n instance (cloud or self-hosted)
migration_guide.step_3: Recreate workflow in n8n with improved logic
migration_guide.step_4: Test thoroughly before deprecating Make.com workflow

when_make_com_still_viable: General business automation (not lead gen specific)
lessons_learned: Platform selection matters for specific use cases
n8n better suited for technical automation workflows
Cost considerations important for high-volume use
Community size and support matters for long-term success
historical_context: Make.com (formerly Integromat) was used for lead enrichment automation but teams migrated to n8n for better control and lower costs in lead gen use cases
